items.content:

Canada stands with Ukraine. 

#StandWithUkraine</article>

items.title: That‚Äôs a wrap on International Development Week 2026!
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>One week. Hundreds of stories. A shared vision for the future. From coast to coast to coast, Canadians joined together to celebrate Prosperity through Partnership.</article>

items.title: Flag Day
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Today we honour the #CanadianFlag and reflect on what the maple leaf represents at home and around the world. üçÅ 

As global landscapes shift and new opportunities of cooperation emerge, Canada is reinforcing its role abroad through deeper engagement, strategic partnerships, diversified trade, enhanced security cooperation, and a revitalized diplomatic presence.  
  
Our flag reminds us of the relationships we nurture, the principles we uphold, and the resilience that keeps Canada strong.</article>

items.title: Why are partnerships essential for prosperity?
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Students, professors and practitioners at the University of Ottawa shared a clear message: No country can tackle today‚Äôs global challenges alone. 

Whether addressing poverty, inequality or economic growth, strong partnerships are essential. When countries, the private sector and civil society partner, they can create lasting solutions and shared prosperity. 

 #IDW2026 #Partnerships #InternationalDevelopment</article>

items.title: Why does international development matter to Canada?
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>For International Development Week, we walked the halls of the University of Ottawa to ask students, faculty members and practitioners a question: 
Why does international development matter to Canada?</article>

items.title: Economic Development Explainer
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Part of our explainer series on international development, this episode looks at how Canada‚Äôs economic development efforts abroad support growth and create benefits for Canadians.

Economic challenges don‚Äôt stop at borders ‚Äî and neither do opportunities. Canada works with partners abroad to reduce poverty, grow economies, and strengthen markets. Learn how global partnerships help drive shared prosperity and a more stable future for all. #EconomicDevelopment #IDW2026</article>

items.title: Want to See How International Volunteering Changes Lives?

items.content:

She returned more skilled, inspired, and ready to make an impact‚Äîat home and abroad!</article>

items.title: Canada‚Äôs Technical Assistance Partnership (TAP) in Jamaica and Dominica
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>For #IDW2026, we spoke with Head of Cooperation Shehryar Sarwar.</article>

items.title: #IDW2026 has officially begun!
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>Join Secretary of State Randeep Sarai and Parliamentary Secretary Yasir Naqvi in celebrating Prosperity through Partnership and the many ways Canadians work with global partners to build a more resilient world.</article>

items.title: International Development Week: Prosperity through Partnership.
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content:
<article>Secretary of State Randeep Sarai unveils the theme of this year‚Äôs International Development Week: Prosperity through Partnership.

Canada and its global partners are building a more sustainable, prosperous future‚Äîtogether.</article>

items.title: Canada Trade Mission to Italy
items.author: Global Affairs Canada
items.content: <article>Minister Sidhu led 75 Canadian organizations to Italy for a Canada Trade Mission. Why Italy? We asked the Canadian delegates!</article>
